alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:07PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following area, Coffee. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elba, Lee, Wise Mill, Bluff Spring, Zoar, Lowry Mill, Arcus, Jack, Newby, Wilkinstown, Carl Folsom A/p, Victoria, Pine Level, Danleys Crossroads, Chestnut Grove, Curtis, Clowers Crossroads, Frisco and Roeton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
